Melt!

The Melt electro night has been around since the beginning of last term, yet it seems to be steadily growing in stature and blending into the environment of York's small underground electronic music scene.

Dream Theater

The American progressive metal band, comprising of five members of virtuosic ability, have had an epic history.

Noisettes guitarist Dan Smith

Bang Face

The term 'rave' is as contested a concept as any that exists within popular music. For some a rave should only ever mean a free party, preferably in a field or a warehouse, for others the term is just for a type of 90's hard house, and for quite a few others rave just means neon paint and glowsticks

Isaac Hewlings

Instead of making you wait for it, I'm just going to mention Michael Jackson immediately. He's dead. A talented musician and dancer, probably. Dead, certainly.

Nouse Playlist

<strong>Laura Hulley: </strong> Michael Jackson - 'Billie Jean' <strong>Isaac Hewlings:</strong>De Tropix- 'Brap' <strong>Tom Killingbeck:</strong>: Dinosaur Jr. - 'Over It' <strong>Estella Adeyeri:</strong> Lovvers - 'OCD Go Go Girls'

Brand New

It's a strange but ultimately great feeling when the band on stage seem to be even more thankful to be there than the audience.

Sunn O)))

The latest burnt offering from the doom-drone godheads does exactly what it says on the tin.

Dan Le Sac vs. Scroobius Pip

<strong>Estella Adeyeri</strong> interviews the DJ and beatpoet team, Dan Le Sac vs Scroobius Pip.

Hope. Peace. Soul.

The King Blues' frontman Johnny Fox talks punk and politics with <strong>Estella Adeyeri</strong>.

Nouse Playlist

Cursive

As five quirky alt-rockers took to the stage, the crowd's atmosphere was one of bubbling anticipation - the criminally underrated band Cursive were about to unleash their divine musical force upon their devoted following.

Beatcake

It's been a busy few days for electronic music in York.

Isaac Hewlings

It appears to me that there is no better an expression of youthful energy and joy in life than the humble house-party. Made iconic in a thousand music videos, (anyone remember the Jimmy Eat World 'The Middle' video?) and another thousand American High School series, surely this represents the high-water mark of socialising?

The Maccabees

The Maccabees found their name by flicking through the bible and picking out a random word.

Ed Banger Records

For every genre that becomes mainstream, or influences the mainstream, there has to be an odder, less straightforward artistic force in the background.

Nouse Playlist

Deliciously simple, and yet completely insane. There's little musical ingenuity going on here, just an over-an-over synth riff laced with splashes of repetitive lyrics which are, unsurprisingly, all about shoes.

Pulled Apart By Horses

Pulled Apart By Horses are the most insane, life-affirming band to come out of England, let alone Leeds, for a long while

Two Tongues

A more fitting opening to this eponymous debut would in fact be the album's 'Interlude', in which a female vocalist tells of the chance meeting of two guys who bond late on a Saturday night over 'movies made about outer space'.

Isaac Hewlings

Not content with making this comment filled with the kind of geeky music trivia that stops people from talking to me at parties, this edition I've decided to create an even more unholy alliance of music and internet geekery.

NME Headliners Glasvegas

From Scotland to Japan:<strong> Tom Killingbeck</strong> interviews NME Headliners Glasvegas.

Comic Relief Queen

No one can be blamed for doing a double take when hearing (and seeing) The Saturdays for the first time.

Nouse Playlist

Lady Gaga - 'Poker Face': at the time of writing, Lady Gaga has two singles in the Top Ten.

Isaac Hewlings

A phenomenon has occurred, which before it goes any further, compels me to add a few words of warning.

Emmy the Great

Emmy the Great is another rising star heralded as "the next big thing".

The Apples

One might argue that a music review can't all be positive; this is journalism, not advertising!

Isaac Hewlings

Some things in life sometimes appear totally inexplicable - the printed sign in my local, which has the legend 'Drugs' crossed out, for example. I like to imagine a situation in which a couple of junkies walk in, spot the sign, turn around and then head off to a more welcoming hostelry, muttering something about bigoted locals

Emmy The Great

A girl, and a guitar. A 'singer-songwriter', dare I venture. Throw your preconceptions out the window, because the stereotypical labels that surround the 'anti-folk' Emmy the Great (real name Emma Lee Robson) fall away from her the minute she opens her mouth.

That's Not My Name.

One of the first things any wannabe band does is to start thinking about a name. Almost all would-be musicians feel the need to christen their creations before they can assume the mantle of 'bandship'.

Nouse playlist

Filthy Dukes - 'This Rhythm': The latest single from London-based band Filthy Dukes is inoffensive, and at best mildly entertaining.
